project.name: Phaidra+
project.description: The Phaidra+ visually enhanced UI for Phaidra

resources.name: resources
resources.description:
The search query manager should be used to call the GSA with specific search queries.
It provides methods to set a normal search term and search terms for specific meta tags.

The basic process should be like:

1. create an instance of the searchRequestManager
2. register for 'searchFinished' event.
3. set the query parameters (META Search – method:setQueryParam or Fulltext method:setQueryTerm)
4. load the search results (method:load) or trigger the event 'search' on $(window) and provide search field data, start and pagesize.
and repeat with 2. if required

helpers.name: helpers
helpers.description:
Phaidra+ Objekt is a generic data container which helps normalize data from the GSA and can render the contents tailored to the needs a certain view.
The templates for each view are stored in the Handlebars templates in the template folder.

main.name: main
main.description:
The geo view class displays the search result on a map

- changeDisplayed
- marked

## Global Events Triggered

- downloadSingleObject
- openSingleView

- [template:geo-view.hbs](../../templates/geo-view.hbs)
- [template:marker.hbs](../../templates/marker.hbs)
- [uncategorizesObjects](uncategorizesObjects.html)

search.name: search
search.description:
This is a class used as a single instance in the phaidra+ app.
It creates a search dropdown which includes all UI to configure a search request.
If any useful search query can be created, the search is executed by triggering **search.ph-plus** event.
On all other occassions, an error is displayed.

### Todo's

- update search UI depending on search results

phaidraObject.name: phaidraObject
phaidraObject.description:
Phaidra+ Objekt is a generic data container which helps normalize data from the GSA and can render the contents tailored to the needs a certain view.
The templates for each view are stored in the Handlebars templates in the template folder.

params.name: data
params.description: The GSA Dataset

params.name: view
params.description: The view to create the HTML Code for

uncategorizesObjects.name: uncategorizesObjects
uncategorizesObjects.description:
If an object has no time or location data it is displayed in the bottom container of the corresponding view.
This class provides the means to do so.

## Dependencies
- [template:uncategorised-objs.hbs](../../templates/uncategorised-objs.hbs)
- [template:map-object.hbs](../../templates/map-object.hbs)

params.name: data
params.description: The uncategorized objects' data.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the bottom container

collectionManager.name: collectionManager
collectionManager.description:
If an object has no time or location data it is displayed in the bottom container of the corresponding view.
This class provides the means to do so.

## Defines
- 'collectionMan' in the resourceManager

## Events Consumed
- addToCollection.ph-plus
- changeCollectionProperty.ph-plus
- createCollection.ph-plus	 
- deleteCollection.ph-plus
- deleteItemFromCollection.ph-plus
- updateCollectionOrder.ph-plus

## Events Triggered
- openLightRoomCollections
- rawSearch
- collectionSaved

- [phaidraQue](phaidraQue.html)
- [resourceManager](resourceManager.html)
- [template:collection-modal.hbs](../../templates/collection-modal.hbs)

dataManager.name: dataManager
dataManager.description:
The data manager gets the raw data from a search request, transform it into usable and displayable objects
and provides useful methods to sort, restrict data or manipulate it.

The lightroom collections class displays the owner's collections on the startpage of phaidra+.

## Events Triggered
- changeCollectionProperty
- clearSearchUI
- createCollection
- dataManaged
- deleteCollection
- deleteItemFromCollection
- ingestObject
- updateCollectionOrder

## Dependencies

- [ppt](ppt.html)
- [resourceManager](resourceManager.html)
- [template:lightroom-collections.hbs](../../templates/lightroom-collections.hbs)

phaidraQue.name: phaidraQue
phaidraQue.description:
The phaidra que eases the communication with the phaidra API.
It provides registering queries on a que and execution one after the other.
Callbacks are executed then each query is successfully finished.

pptCreator.name: pptCreator
pptCreator.description:
This helper class is used to create a Powerpoint Presentation on the fly from an array of phaidra objects.
The class basically displays a modal dialog and when a PPT is requested, the class calls the pptEndPoint
to have the Powerpoint File created. The returned file path is set as the new location of the window and hence
the download is started. After this process the class instance is deleted.

## Dependencies
- [basics](basics.html)
- [template:ppt-modal.hbs](../../templates/ppt-modal.hbs)

params.name: collectionData
params.description: An array of objects - preferably from a collection

resourceManager.name: resourceManager
resourceManager.description: Register global sitewide events and handlers with the resourceManager.

searchFilter.name: searchFilter
searchFilter.description:
The searchFilter class is used to create and manage a certain search input field.
The searchFilter supports multiple types:

- boolean
- date
- enum
- objects
- radio
- select with option groups
- text

## Todos

- add range selections

params.name: dP
params.description: The DOM parent to insert the filter into

params.name: field
params.description: The name of the META Tag to represent - according to config/searchfields.js

params.name: val
params.description: The start value assigned to the META Tag

searchRequestManager.name: searchRequestManager
searchRequestManager.description:
The search query manager should be used to call the GSA with specific search queries.
It provides methods to set a normal search term and search terms for specific meta tags.

The basic process should be like:

1. create an instance of the searchRequestManager
2. register for 'searchFinished' event.
3. set the query parameters (META Search – method:setQueryParam or Fulltext method:setQueryTerm)
4. load the search results (method:load) or trigger the event 'search' on $(window) and provide search field data, start and pagesize.
and repeat with 2. if required

standalone.name: standalone
standalone.description:
The standalone class is only used in the standalone mode and is a bridging class to get the query parameters from the calling url
into work by starting a standalone-search.

## Global Events Triggered
- window:standalone-error
- window:standalone-search

timelineObject.name: timelineObject
timelineObject.description:

params.name: saveMode
params.description: Toggle to disable specific functions not supported in standalone mode.

classitems.description:
Method creates a spinner over the specified object. Uses the external/spin.js library.
Attaches a function under 'ph-plus-removeLoader' which can remove the spinner from the object.
If a spinner has already been attached, the spinner is cleared from the object and the object returned.
classitems.name: makeLoading

params.name: jQueryObject
params.description: The target jQuery object where to apply the spinner to.

return.description: the manipulated target object

classitems.description:
Method to remove the loading spinner from the specified object.
Looks for a function under 'ph-plus-removeLoader' and executes it.
classitems.name: removeLoading

params.name: jQueryObject
params.description: The target jQuery object where to apply the spinner to.

return.description: the manipulated target object

classitems.description:
Method to turn a string into a camelCased string.
For instance 'ph-plus-removeLoader' gets converted to 'phPlusRemoveLoader'.
classitems.name: toCamel

params.name: String
params.description: The string to convert

classitems.description:
Bridging function for the jquery.timeago plugin (external/jquery.timeago.js)
A plugin that makes it easy to support automatically updating fuzzy timestamps (e.g. "4 minutes ago" or "about 1 day ago").
http://plugins.jquery.com/timeago/

classitems.description:
Method called after data has been loaded from the GSA.
Checks the results, repairs the data and creates _P_ objects from the data.
After successful conversation, sets itself as the resource 'gsaData' with the resource manager and triggers all events of the class.
classitems.name: manageData

params.name: Data
params.description: The result data to convert into a result set.

params.name: alert
params.description: Shall there be an alert when no results were returned?

classitems.description:
Method to mark all currently displayed objects.
Triggers  {{#crossLink "dataManager/marked:event"}}{{/crossLink}},
{{#crossLink "dataManager/changeDisplayed:event"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "dataManager/change:event"}}{{/crossLink}} if appropriate.

Method to invert the marked objects. So all marked objects get unmarked and vice versa.

The title of the collection to display.

params.name: Identifier

classitems.description:
Set a specific display mode (all|marked|collection|keyword).
If set to 'collection' the value of {{#crossLink "dataManager/selectedCollection:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}} is used.
If set to 'keyword' the value of {{#crossLink "dataManager/selectedKeyword:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}} is used.
Triggers {{#crossLink "dataManager/displayModeChanged:event"}}{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: setDisplayMode

params.name: Enum
params.description:
The display mode to set (all|marked|collection|keyword)
return {Object} self

classitems.description:
Method to remove all display restrictions and show all objects of the current result set.
Triggers {{#crossLink "dataManager/changeDisplayed:event"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "dataManager/change:event"}}{{/crossLink}}.
If the former display mode was 'marked' it also triggers {{#crossLink "dataManager/marked:event"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: showAll

classitems.description:
Method updating the currently marked objects array (dataManager:objectsmarked).
Uses {{#crossLink "dataManager/isObjMarked:method"}}{{/crossLink}} to check whether an object was stared/marked.

return.description: self

classitems.description: Event called when the connection times out.
classitems.name: phaidraQue:connection-timeout

classitems.description: connection timer.
classitems.name: connectionTimer

classitems.description:
The user credentials to use with the phaidra endpoint.

    { 'username': 'XXX', 'password': 'XXX', 'realname': 'XXX' }
classitems.name: credentials

classitems.description:
The currently run que item. The que item carries the following properties:

- 'cb': the callback
- 'd': the call data
- 'p': the url
- 'st': send authentication token or credentials?
- 't': ajax send type; see [jQuery Ajax send types](http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax/), which are basically GET or POST
classitems.name: currentQueItem

classitems.description: The endpoint to call.
classitems.name: endPoint

classitems.description: The query que.
classitems.name: que

classitems.description: Flag indicating whether the query que is currently running a query or is idle.
classitems.name: processing

classitems.description: Backreference.
classitems.name: self

classitems.description: Fixed timeout timespan after which a broken connection will be assumed.
classitems.name: self

classitems.description:
The XSRF-TOKEN returned by the API after credentials have been sent.
Can be used instead of sending credentials again and saving exposure of security relevant information.
classitems.name: xsrfToken

classitems.description: Method diguesting connection timeout error
classitems.name: connectionTimeoutError

return.description: self

classitems.description: Getter Function for the real username of the [credentials](phaidraQue.html#properties).

return.description: self

classitems.description:
Event handler for ajax requests. If the response includes a new XSRF-TOKEN it is saved.
Possible username, realname and XSRF-TOKEN are saved in the cookies.
If the current que item had a callback it will be executed.
classitems.name: eventHandler

return.description: self

classitems.description:
Method to execute a API query with a certain setup specified via the given parameters.
Pushes a query setup onto the que and starts the que.

params.name: path
params.description: The sub path to call

params.name: data
params.description: The data to send

params.name: callback
params.description: An optional callback to execute after response

params.name: type
params.description: The HTTP method to use

params.name: sendToken
params.description: Flag indicating whether login credentials shall be sent or not.

return.description: self

return.description: self

classitems.description: Method to execute a keep alive action on the API
classitems.name: keepAlive

return.description: self

classitems.description: Method executing the next action on the process que if there is any.
classitems.name: processNext

return.description: self

classitems.description: The path to call to have the powerpoint created.
classitems.name: pptEndPoint

classitems.description: Property holding the current active state of the resource manager, i.e. the event which has been fired last.
classitems.name: currentState

classitems.description:
A default configuration object. All provided configuration objects get extended by this to get the appropriate default values.

			{
				'close': { 'func': function() {}, 'scope': null, 'data': null },
				'deps': null,
				'open': { 'func': function() {}, 'scope': null, 'data': null },
			}

Alternatively func and scope can be a string.

- If func is a string and scope is null, a global function is assumed and called.
- If scope is a string, then an object of that class is created and func is called as a method of that object.
classitems.name: defaultConf

classitems.description: Property containing the list of last states. Used for reverting back to the old state by .back()
classitems.name: oldStates

classitems.description: An array containing all registered events and the connected handlers
classitems.name: states

classitems.description: An array containing all registered resources.
classitems.name: resources

classitems.description: Backreference
classitems.name: self

classitems.description: Method to enable further state switching. I.e. if a switch gets requested, these will get processed.
classitems.name: continue

classitems.description: Method to camelcase a str
classitems.name: createClassName

params.name: str
params.description: the String to transform

return.description: the camelcased String

classitems.description: Method to switch to a new [state] or close an old one depending on [dir]. Additional data might be appended to the calls.
classitems.name:
doState
chainable

params.name: state
params.description: the state to open/close

params.name: dir
params.description: the direction to go (open|close)

params.name: addData
params.description: the data to append

classitems.description: Method to retrieve a set resource by name

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the resource to retrieve

return.description: the resource if set

classitems.description: Method to pause execution of state switches
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description:
Method to register a global event and the corresponding handler.
You can add multiple handlers to the same event by altering the name.
The handler configuration will be expanded by the default configuration object of the resource manager.
classitems.name: register

params.name: state
params.description: the sitewide event to listen to

params.name: name
params.description: a name for this specific handler

params.name: conf
params.description: a configuration object following {{#crossLink "resourceManager/currentState:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}}

classitems.description: Method to remove an event handler from the handler stack {{#crossLink "resourceManager/states:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: remove

params.name: state
params.description: the sitewide event to listen to

params.name: name
params.description: a name for this specific handler

classitems.name: requireCallback

params.name: data
params.description: Parameters for the function/method call

params.name: func
params.description: The function/method to execute

params.name: scope
params.description: The scope/classname of the method to execute or the class to create

params.name: dependency
params.description: a dependecy object containing the class to create

classitems.description:
Method to set new config settings on a specific state (or wildcard '*') and name in the states array.
Useful to set the instance of an object or similar circumstances when the scope object or function is
not available at startup.
classitems.name: setConfig

params.name: state
params.description: the sitewide event to listen to

params.name: name
params.description: a name for this specific handler

params.name: conf
params.description: a configuration object following {{#crossLink "resourceManager/currentState:defaultConf"}}{{/crossLink}}

return.description: the resource manager itself

classitems.description: Method to add a resource to the resourceManager.
classitems.name: setResource

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new resource / resource to overwrite.

params.name: data
params.description: The resource(data)

classitems.description:
Generic event handler called on all global events registered.
The handler calls all __close handlers__ of the current state,
then changes the {{#crossLink "resourceManager/currentState:property"}}{{/crossLink}} property to the new state
and now calls all open handlers for the new state.
Dependencies are loaded using requirejs methods.
classitems.name: switch

params.name: newState
params.description: The new state to switch to

params.name: addData
params.description: Additional Data provided by the event handler

return.description: returns true of newState was not found. false if state switching was successfully started.

classitems.description: Event called when the input changes from filled (valid input) to an empty input.

classitems.description: Event fired when escape is pressed on the input.

classitems.description: Event fired when the input changes from empty to an filled state, meaning that some valid content is available.

classitems.description:
Method called when filter is first initiated.
Sets up the config for HTML, the DOM id, etc.

params.name: v
params.description: Value of the META Tag

classitems.description:
Eventhandler called when the input receives focus.
Enables the keyboard event handler to check the states cleared, filled, enter, escape.

params.name: e
params.description: The event object delivered by the event handler.

classitems.description:
Eventhandler called when the input looses focus.
Disables the keyboard event handler to check the states cleared, filled, enter, escape.
classitems.name: stopInputManagement

params.name: e
params.description: The event object delivered by the event handler.

Uses the translation library in  nls depending on the language indicated by the browser.

return.description: the translation, if existing.

classitems.name: loading

classitems.name: maxLoadTime

classitems.description: The number of search results to retrieve from the GSA
classitems.name: pageSize

classitems.description:
Method to retrieve the overall search query - i.e. the META Tags search setup plus the normal GSA search setup.
All cleaned of non-set properties
classitems.name: getQuerySetup

return.description: the query setup

classitems.description: Method to query the GSA. It creates the AJAX get query and sets a timeout function.

params.name: q
params.description: the normal search term

params.name: start
params.description: the index of the first result to load (pagination)

params.name: num
params.description: the number of results to load (pagination)

classitems.description:
Method called when GSA returns results successfully.
Triggers ['searchFinished' event](searchRequestManager.html#events).
classitems.name: loadSuccess

params.name: data
params.description: the result of the GSA call.

params.name: callback
params.description: a callback to execute instead of the event.

params.name: reset
params.description: shall the gsaData be reset?

classitems.description:
Method called when GSA returned an error.
Triggers ['searchFinished' event](searchRequestManager.html#events).
classitems.name: loadError

params.name: event
params.description: the event data

classitems.description:
Event handler called when GSA request ended in an timeout.
Triggers ['searchFinished' event](searchRequestManager.html#events).
classitems.name: loadTimeout

classitems.description: A method to load the next page of the result set. Increases the [currentRequest's](searchRe) start property by one and reloads the search.
classitems.name: loadNextPage

return.description: Either self or false if still loading another request.

classitems.description: A method to load the previous page of the result set.
classitems.name: loadPreviousPage

return.description: Either self or false if still loading another request.

classitems.description: A private helper method to check whether a value is boolean
classitems.name: matchValueToBoolean

params.name: value
params.description: The value to test

return.description: Either null on failure or the value.

classitems.description:
A method to match a value against a template if the template is an enum|select.
It simply looks in the template array if the value is found.
classitems.name: matchValueToEnum

params.name: value
params.description: The value to test

params.name: template
params.description: The possible values

return.description: Either null on failure or the value.

classitems.description: Method to check whether a value is a valid Integer or Float.
classitems.name: matchValueToNumber

params.name: value
params.description: The value can be Integer, Float or smaller/greater String (..[Integer]..) - see GSA documentation

return.description: Either null on validation failure or the value

classitems.description:
A method to match a value against a template if the template is an object.
It simply compares the properties of both and checks if all are set in the value,
that are required by the template.
classitems.name: matchValueToObject

params.name: template
params.description: The object representing the template

params.name: value
params.description: The object to test

return.description: Either null on failure or the value.

classitems.description: Helper function matching a value to be a text (not undefined or null or of zero length)
classitems.name: matchValueToText

return.description: null if not a text or the string

classitems.description:
A method to parse and match a given value against the META Tag definition defined by name.
Gets the type of the META Tag and checks if the given value is possible or not.
classitems.name: parseQueryParamValue

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the META Tag to validate against

params.name: value
params.description: the proposed value to check

return.description: Either false on failure or the value if correct.

classitems.description:
Method executing the GSA query setup. Basically starts $.getJSON with the appropriate event handler and adds a loading spinner to the body.
A timeout is started to check for connection timeouts.
classitems.name: rawLoad

params.name: query
params.description: The query to execute

params.name: callback
params.description: a callback to execute after the result has been loaded

params.name: reset
params.description: shall the gsaData be reset?

classitems.description: Method to start a raw search, meaning the query term has to be provided, but therefore won't be touched
classitems.name: rawSearch

params.name: query
params.description: The query to execute

params.name: required
params.description: The requiredfields to use for the query; content types for image, text, picture, pdf and paper are defaults.

params.name: start
params.description: the first result object to retrieve

params.name: number
params.description: the number of results to fetch; maximum is 100.

params.name: callback
params.description: a callback to execute after the result has been loaded

params.name: true
params.description: flag passed on to rawLoad

params.name: additions
params.description: an arbitrary object to extend the load setup to support additional query parameters

return.description: Either the searchRequestManager or false if currently loading another query.

classitems.description: Method displaying a link which can be used to display a link in a modal dialog to the current search and view in the standalone version.
classitems.name: showShareLink

return.description: Either self or false on failure

classitems.description:
Method to start a search immediately from scratch.
Provide an  array of field values ({ 'key':value, 'boolean':[AND|OR] }),
the start position of the first item to return and the number of items to fetch.
classitems.name: startSearch

params.name: fields
params.description: An array of key:values pairs representing the search fields.

params.name: start
params.description: The first search result to fetch

return.description: [size] The number of results to get (maximum).

params.name: value

params.name: bool
params.description: The boolean operator to add between the current and before value.

return.description: Either false on failure (validation of the value fails) or the searchRequestManager object itself (for chaining).

Method to start the search. If not enough input is avaible an error is thrown.
